alert.note: Alert for City of Harrisonburg; City of Waynesboro (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 7:14PM EST until January 09 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and western Virginia, including the following counties, in northwest Virginia, Page, Shenandoah and Warren. In western Virginia, Augusta, City of Harrisonburg, City of Staunton, City of Waynesboro and Rockingham. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 714 PM EST, Emergency management reported some minor ongoing flooding in low-lying areas across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additionally, a couple of river gauges continue to rise towards or into action stage. - Light additional rainfall is expected, but additional heavy rainfall is no longer expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harrisonburg... Staunton... Waynesboro... Strasburg... Woodstock... Stuarts Draft... Bridgewater... Luray... Broadway... Grottoes... Timberville... Shenandoah... Massanutten... Crimora... Mount Jackson... Stanley... Sherando... Dale Enterprise... Basye-Bryce Mountain... Big Meadows... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: City of Harrisonburg; City of Waynesboro
